result.execSummary:
The defendant Rontrell J Luckett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: *The court informed the defendant that if he completes all of the programs required of him prior to the 2 years, the agent may ask for early release of the defendant's probation.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay all other costs and surcharges; civil judgment if not paid.
*Pay supervision fees.
*Due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

*Attend parenting classes.
*Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
*The defendant may have contact with his child as long as it does not violate any other orders that are in effect.
*Defendant to comply with any Children's Court orders.
*If the parties are unable to agree as to placement of the child, the court instructed the parties that they must file motion/s in the Family Courts.
*Agent to determine if any AODA assessment and treatment is needed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rontrell J Luckett

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Request for payment of $17  witness fees for witness Tabbitha S. S. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26213408 in court 1x on 9/9/15.
Request for payment of 17 witness fees for witness Weston L. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26213407 in court 1x on 9/9/15.

Defendant Rontrell J Luckett in court with attorney Jerome J. Shimek.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
The parties are in court for a jury trial.  Parties met at sidebar.
.
Case passed...
.
Recalled.
The parties have reached a resolution in this case.
. 
Charge is amended to "Child Abuse-Recklessly Causing Harm", pursuant to Wisc. stats. 948.03(3)(b), a Class I felony.
As to charge as amended:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
.
Parties proceeded to sentencing.
.
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Additional statements by:  W.L. and Tabbitha S.
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 11 months in the House of Correction with credit for -0- days served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for up to 2 years  with the following conditions:
- Attend parenting classes.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- Agent to determine if any AODA assessment and treatment is needed.
- The defendant may have contact with his child as long as it doews not violate any other orders that are in effect.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Defendant to comply with any Childen's Court orders.
- Pay all other costs and surcharges; civil judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees.

.
The court informed the defendant that if he completes all of the programs required of him prior to the 2 years, the agent may ask for early release of the defendant's probation.

If the parties are unable to agree as to placement of the child, the court instructed the parties that they must file motion/s in the Family Courts.
 
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Defendant Rontrell J Luckett in court with attorney Jerome J. Shimek.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  cab
Received and filed:
State's Motion in Limine.
State's Requested Jury Instructions.
Notice of Expert Testimony.
State's Witness List.
State's Brief in Support of Motion to Instroduce Other Acts Evidence.
 Final pretrial conference held.   Case remains calendared on 09/09/2015 at 08:30 a.m. for jury trial in Branch 36.

Defendant Rontrell J Luckett in court with attorney Jerome J. Shimek.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Final Pretrial date. State's motioned to adjourn Jury Trial date. Defense objected. Court GRANTED adjournment of the Jury Trial date. State's offer is extended to new Final Pretrial date. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 36.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions.

Defendant Rontrell J Luckett in court with attorney Jerome J. Shimek.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case heard off the record. FILE NOT IN COURT. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Court advised parties that all discovery must be turned over, all witness lists and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. State revoked the offer at this time. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing APRIL 10 2015,  received and filed. (11 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to MR. JEROME SHIMEK, 910 ELM GROVE RD, #3 - ELM GROVE, WI  53122.

Defendant Rontrell J Luckett in court with attorney Jerome J. Shimek.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
BRANCH 40 FOR BRANCH 23.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  City of Milwaukee Police Officer Andrew Wagner.  Defendant stipulated to being the father of the child for purposed of this hearing only.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Branch 23 in trial, case spun to Judge Dallet branch 40.

15RM017535  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04/01/2015
Court ordered the remaining cash bail to be returned to the remitter.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with W.L. (dob 9-20-2009)., and Tabbitha S.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 23.

Defendant Rontrell J Luckett in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Flanagan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Grady, Br. 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/3/15 @ 1:30pm
